intro: Echinopsis fallax var. catamarcensis, commonly known as the Catamarcensis Cactus, is a species native to Argentina. It belongs to the Cactaceae family and is characterized by its short, cylindrical stems and prominent areoles. The plant produces white to pale yellow flowers during the warmer months, typically in spring. It is a slow-growing species that thrives in well-draining soil and full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and rarity, it is often cultivated by succulent enthusiasts.
